Synthea
Audio for Unscripted Theater
Synthea is a free, customizable soundboard program designed for dynamic playback of sound effects, ambience, and music in unscripted performances. It was written for use in improvised theater, but is ideal for any live production where pre-programmed cues won't cut it.

What Synthea Does

Synthea creates soundboards for realtime playback of sound effects, ambience, and music. Its easy-to-use interface makes it an accessible solution to any live production, while its powerful features provide deep customization and precision for advanced users.

Some key features include:

Convenient Queuing
Line up sound cues in advance to play back when you need them— on demand, sequentially, or all at once.

Automatic Crossfading
When a sound cue is paused or stopped, Synthea automatically fades the sound out so you don't have to think about it. With realtime board switches and cue-specific settings, you can choose on-the-fly whether new cues fade in or start at full volume.

Smart Subgroups
Tag sound cues to different "subgroups" to control overlays. Cues in the same subgroup replace one another, while cues in different subgroups play concurrently.

Individual Playback Controls
Each sound cue, whether playing or queued up, has individual controls for play, pause, seek, and loop. Complete control is at your fingertips.

Hotkeys
Program keyboard shortcuts to frequently-used sound cues so you can play them instantly no matter where you are on the board.

File Randomization
Attach multiple sound files to a single cue for randomized, non-repeating playback. Each time you hit the cue, a different file will play—for a more immersive experience.

Scalable, Searchable, Tab-Based Interface
Handle dozens or even hundreds of sound cues in a project with Synthea's easy board layout. A global search is just a keypress away, so you can find any cue you want in seconds.

Why Synthea Exists

In unscripted theater, a sound board operator needs to access effects and music in ways that scripted theater software simply can't handle. Programs like QLab and Show Cue Systems can be powerful when audio playback is carefully planned and played in sequence, but are too cumbersome for the unpredictable, seat-of-your-pants sound design of improvisation and unscripted theater.

As a tech improviser, I once needed the ability to engage in realtime, unscripted conversation between performers onstage and an "artificial intelligence" controlled by me in the booth. The AI's dialogue would need to be synthesized from pre-recorded sentence fragments, which would require software to assemble the cues on-the-fly and play them back seamlessly in real-time.

Unable to find any soundboard software capable of this task, I wrote the first version of Synthea to do just that. I immediately saw the value this software could provide beyond synthesizing dialogue, and since then Synthea has expanded to provide customized music and sound effects boards for dozens of other plays, variety shows, and improv performances around the world.

The software is still in its infancy, but for those ready to try it out, I hope Synthea proves to be a useful tool.
